Acolyte.Title: Servant of the Temple
Acolyte.Description:
A man of the church.
A mistress of the gods.
Or a corrupt priest overcome by gluttony and greed.
You have spent your life in the service of a temple to a specific god or pantheon of gods. Choose a god, a pantheon of gods, or some other quasi-divine being, and work with your DM to detail the nature of your religious service.
Acolyte.Language: You can speak a Higher language of choice.

~Proficiency in Religion~.Effect: Add your Level to Wisdom or Intelligence Checks for religious purposes (e.g. knowing about religions, religious customs, praying, performing sermons, trusting your faith, etc).
~Proficiency in Religion~.Name: ~Proficiency in Religion~

Antiquarian.Title: The Collector
Antiquarian.Description:
You live for the smell of dusty books and forgotten heirlooms.
There are no items too important to not put a price tag on.
Perhaps you are a hoarder or a scavenger; either way, new or old, every item has its values.

~Proficiency in Investigation~.Effect: Add your Level to all Intelligence Checks for closely examining small to medium objects.
~Proficiency in Investigation~.Name: ~Proficiency in Investigation~

Apothecary.Title: The Physician
Apothecary.Description:
The various smells and textures of living tissue are all organized thoroughly inside your mind.
You know of both ailments and cures and no organ is too complex to understand and study.
An Apothecary is a doctor, pharmacist or someone who studies the biology and phisiology of plants and animals.

~Proficiency in Biology~.Effect: Add your Level to all Intelligence Checks for knowing about the biology and phisiology or animals, humaonids and plants and identifying illnesses, poisons or cures.
~Proficiency in Biology~.Name: ~Proficiency in Biology~

~Proficiency in Smelling~.Effect: Add your Level to all Wisdom Checks for sensing smells.
~Proficiency in Smelling~.Name: ~Proficiency in Smelling~

Artisan.Title: The Craftsman
Artisan.Description:
The path of craftsmanship was shown to you in life and imbued you with the unusual skill of piecing components together to unlock mankind's true power: creation.
Wether you're smithing tools and weapons in a forge, carving figures in stone, fletching arrows or building structures block by block, you're skilled in using your hands and wit to craft things from materials.
An Artisan is crafter specialized in a domain, such as smithing, carving, constructing, etc.
Artisan.Variants: Blacksmith, Fletcher, Bowyer, Carpenter, Mason, etc
Artisan.Training: You are trained in Hand Hammers.

~Proficiency in Crafting~.Effect: Add your Level to all Checks for crafting items (e.g. improvised traps, weapons or tools, rafts, structures, setting up a tent, etc).
~Proficiency in Crafting~.Name: ~Proficiency in Crafting~

Cook.Title: The Master Chef
Cook.Description:
Ah, the aroma of the spices and the smell of freshly baked funnel cakes.
Or perhaps you prefer the taste of ale or wine? In that case, consider yourself a brewmaster.
Mixing and matching ingredients, you always knew what tastes the best!

~Proficiency in Cooking~.Effect: Add your Level to all Checks for making food, brewing potions or poisons, identifying edible plants, etc.
~Proficiency in Cooking~.Name: ~Proficiency in Cooking~

~Proficiency in Smelling~.Effect: Add your Level to all Wisdom Checks for sensing smells.
~Proficiency in Smelling~.Name: ~Proficiency in Smelling~

Criminal.Title: Law Breaker
Criminal.Description:
You're accustomed to the world of murder, theft and robbery that goes on in cities in plain sight, in front of the eyes of the oblivious.
Whether alone or part of a group, your dagger is constantly ready behind someone's back, just as other criminals' daggers are constantly behind yours.
Criminal.Language: You know Thieves' Cant, a language that relies on double-speak and secret signs among the streetspeople.

~Proficiency in Stealth~.Effect: Add your Level to all Dexterity Checks for hiding or remaining silent.
~Proficiency in Stealth~.Name: ~Proficiency in Stealth~

Folk Villain.Title: The Living Myth
Folk Villain.Description:
Legend says about you and your malevolent deeds, about your plots and mischieves...
You are notorious among common folk. People have heard about you, but many have not seen it with their own eyes.
They talk about the lord in the black temple, the lone savage in the forest or the wizard atop the tower, in the center of the town.

~Proficiency in Occultism~.Effect: Add your Level to all Intelligence Checks for identifying demons or undead, knowing about rituals, myths or cryptids, old gods, ancient secrets, etc.
~Proficiency in Occultism~.Name: ~Proficiency in Occultism~

Hermit.Title: The Solitary
Hermit.Description:
You lived away from the busy streets of towns and took part of smaller communities, such as a monastery.
Perhaps you chose to live completely alone, in the quiet of nature, in a small haven away from society you call home.
Hermit.Training: You are trained in Spears and Pikes.

~Proficiency in Nature~.Effect: Add your Level to all Wisdom and Intelligence Checks for identifying plants, knowing about nature and the wilds, etc.
~Proficiency in Nature~.Name: ~Proficiency in Nature~

Night Guard.Title: Brother in Arms
Night Guard.Description:
Stand your ground and watch your surroundings.
As a night guard, your duty is to keep the law and protect other citizens.
You're trained in the art of sword and board, and know how to stay alive in the heat of a fight.
Watch your back!
Night Guard.Training: You are trained in Shortswords and Shields.

~Proficiency in Hearing~.Effect: Add your Level to all Wisdom Checks for hearing (e.g. over-hearing dialogue, noticing unusual sounds, discerning sounds, etc).
~Proficiency in Hearing~.Name: ~Proficiency in Hearing~

~Proficiency in Might Intimidation~.Effect: Add your Level to all Might Checks for intimidating non-player characters.
~Proficiency in Might Intimidation~.Name: ~Proficiency in Might Intimidation~

Noble.Title: The Aristocrat
Noble.Description:
There are various types of nobles around these lands, with various different backgrounds.
Some originate from old, well-established families, and lived their lives pampered by their higher ups, avoiding assiduous work.
Others have fought tooth and nail for their position in the high society.
But ask yourself: what made you quit this life and pick up adventuring?
Was your house recently dismissed or destroyed? Or are you simply far away from home?
A Noble is a person of high status, such as a politician or a member of a rich family.
As a Noble, think of a reason your character renounced the life of luxury for traveling and adventuring.
Noble.Language: If your Intelligence is 1 or higher, pick one more Common language you can speak (Dwarvish or Elvish).

~Proficiency in History~.Effect: Add your Level to all Intelligence Checks for recalling past events from the lore of the world (e.g. wars, events, etc).
~Proficiency in History~.Name: ~Proficiency in History~

Outlander.Title: The Lone Wolf
Outlander.Description:
Few live to see the beauty of these lands, for they can't see the forest from the trees.
You grew up in the wilds. You've witnessed the migration of herds larger than forests, survived weather more extreme than any city-dweller could comprehend, and enjoyed the solitude of being the only thinking creature for miles in any direction.
Outlander.Training: You are trained in Quarterstaves and Longbows.

~Proficiency in Survival~.Effect: Add your Level to all Checks for surviving (e.g. resisting wilderness dangers, identifying poisonous berries, lighting a fire, etc).
~Proficiency in Survival~.Name: ~Proficiency in Survival~

Peasant.Title: The Hard Worker
Peasant.Description:
You spent all your life dreaming big, of leaving home and seeking a higher purpose.
The time has come: pack up your bag, pick up your whatever you have and sleep well, for tomorrow your life is about to change.
Follow your calling as a hero!
Peasant.Training: You are trained in one of Tridents (Pitchforks).

~Proficiency in Animal Handling~.Effect: Add your Level to all Wisdom Checks for catching, subduing or tracking animals.
~Proficiency in Animal Handling~.Name: ~Proficiency in Animal Handling~

~Proficiency in Luck~.Effect: Add your Level to all Checks for luck and random chance.
~Proficiency in Luck~.Name: ~Proficiency in Luck~

Politician.Title: The Fair Arbiter
Politician.Description: You're the one who dictated the rules. But were you goal-oriented, or blinded by wealth?

~Proficiency in Charisma Intimidation~.Effect: Add your Level to all Charisma Checks for intimidating non-player characters.
~Proficiency in Charisma Intimidation~.Name: ~Proficiency in Charisma Intimidation~

Charlatan.Title: People's Person
Charlatan.Description:
There is no such thing as a pyramid scheme; your people call them 'legitimate businesses'.
You don't sell goods - you sell ideas! You make people want the unwantable, buy the unbuyable.
It's all illegal, of course.
Charlatan.Language: You know a few phrases in all other Common and Wild languages. Enough to fool, but not enough to carry a conversation.

~Proficiency in Deception~.Effect: Add your Level to all Charisma Checks for lying, fooling or concealing information.
~Proficiency in Deception~.Name: ~Proficiency in Deception~

Pickpocket.Title: The Trickster
Pickpocket.Description:
You never know what you will find in someone's pocket.
You are skilled in using your fingers in more than one way.
For you, the saying is that one man's treasure is another man's trash. For what value do items have other than their value in gold?
Pickpocket.Training: You are trained in Light Crossbows.
Pickpocket.Language: You know Thieves' Cant, a language that relies on double-speak and secret signs among the streetspeople.

~Proficiency in Sleight of Hand~.Effect: Ad your Level to all Checks for fine finger movements (non magical) (e.g. picking a pocket, searching a dumpster, concealing something in your hand, etc)
~Proficiency in Sleight of Hand~.Name: ~Proficiency in Sleight of Hand~

Ruffian.Title: The Street Scoundrel
Ruffian.Description:
The city streets provide the perfect place to get lost in: a labyrinth of wood and stone where the roof of every house is a playground, where no wall is to high to keep you out..
Every nook and cranny provides at least a hiding spot and at best serves as a shortcut or path to secret urban locations.
Ruffian.Language: You know Thieves' Cant, a language that relies on double-speak and secret signs among the streetspeople.

~Proficiency in Acrobatics~.Effect: Add your Level to all Dexterity Checks for jumping, climbing, fitting through gaps, maintaining balance and other acrobatic moves.
~Proficiency in Acrobatics~.Name: ~Proficiency in Acrobatics~

Sailor.Title: Person of the Sea
Sailor.Description:
There's only one thing a man can be more in love with than a woman: the sea!
You sailed on a seagoing vessel for years. In that time, you faced down mighty storms, monsters of the deep, and those who wanted to sink your craft to the bottomless depths.

~Proficiency in Using Rope~.Effect: Add your Level to all Dexterity Checks for using rope (e.g. tying knots, swinging or walking on rope, throwing rope, etc).
~Proficiency in Using Rope~.Name: ~Proficiency in Using Rope~

Sage.Title: Loremaster
Sage.Description:
As an apprentice of magic, you spent your time studying rugged scrolls and dusty books.
You came to understand magic deeper than the average person.
Yet no matter how much you study, you realize that the more you learn, the more you realize how little you know.

~Proficiency in Arcane~.Effect: Add your Level to all Intelligence Checks that related to magic (e.g. identifying spells, magic items or runes, knowledge about magic, etc).
~Proficiency in Arcane~.Name: ~Proficiency in Arcane~

Scholar.Title: The Well-Versed
Scholar.Description:
A life of studying and teaching - the most efficient way to perpetuate the cycle of knowledge.
As a teacher or scholar, you are a jack-of-all-trades in many domains of science.
From literature to mathematics to common sense, you know them all good enough to make sense of this chaotic world.

~Proficiency in General Knowledge~.Effect: Add your Level to all Intelligence Checks for knowing various simple facts about science, astronomy, trades, etc.
~Proficiency in General Knowledge~.Name: ~Proficiency in General Knowledge~

Scout.Title: The Lookout
Scout.Description:
Eye on the horizon, you watch the distant hills for any signs of intruders or friendly visitors.
Your keen sight is paramount in the defense of your society, and in case of an emergency, you're the first to sound the alarm.
Scout.Training: You are trained in Longbows and Blowguns.

~Proficiency in Sight~.Effect: Add your Level to all Wisdom Checks for seeing (e.g. noticing things in darkness, seeing far away objects, recognizing faces, etc).
~Proficiency in Sight~.Name: ~Proficiency in Sight~

Worker.Title: The Handyman
Worker.Description:
People say a worker is made of muscle and blood.
Your hands are ever callous and muscles sore.
Whether you work in a mine, carry around construction materials or you're a simple lumberjack, every drop of sweat is justified.
For at the end of the day, it's all for honest money, the fruit of your labor.
Worker.Training: You are trained in Hand Hammers and Pickaxes.

~Proficiency in Athletics~.Effect: Add your Level to all Might Checks for using your physical strength (e.g. lifting, breaking by hand, etc).
~Proficiency in Athletics~.Name: ~Proficiency in Athletics~
